title: Salt recipe is wrong in the guide

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: A bug that needs to be fixed.

body:
## Description (Required)
<!-- A clear and detailed description of what exactly the Issue consists of. -->
Salt recipe is wrong in the Slimefun guide.

## Steps to reproduce the Issue (Required)
<!-- Youtube Videos and Screenshots are recommended! -->
1. Open guide and search to the salt.
2. The guide writes that 2 sands should be needed.
![81436095-249bb800-9169-11ea-96d4-8a3f2f6b32de](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8324198/81507119-63617780-92fb-11ea-8612-af6f946a7633.png)
![81436093-24032180-9169-11ea-9037-c40e38d3a4bd](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8324198/81507121-65c3d180-92fb-11ea-911b-7d2d3d7172a5.png)

3. If I put 2 sand to Ore Washer do nothing. (Slimefun 4 >Sorry, I could not recognize the Item in my dispenser. Please put something in that I know.)
4. If I put 4 sand to Ore Washer works and creates 1 salt. The guide writes wrong amount sand.

## Expected behavior (Required)
<!-- What did you expect to happen? -->
The guide write correct amount sand or change needed sand amount.

## Server Log / Error Report
<!-- Take a look at your Server Log and please provide any error reports you can find via https://pastebin.com/ -->
<!-- We may discard your Issue if you just post it here, as it's unreadable for us. Please use Pastebin! -->

## Environment (Required)
<!-- We may also close your Issue if you are not providing the exact version numbers. -->
<!-- "latest" IS NOT A VERSION NUMBER. -->
<!-- You can also just run "/sf versions" and show us a screenshot of that. -->

 - Minecraft Version: 1.15.2 (Paper)
 - Slimefun Version: Slimefun vDEV - 500 (git 74c40d5a)
 - CS-CoreLib Version: CS-CoreLib vDEV - 85 (git 4a7fce52)

Just adding this PR, so it can be pulled if it gets a positive score. Close it otherwise.

## Checklist
<!-- After posting your issue, please check the boxes below if they apply -->
- [X ] I have fully tested the proposed changes and promise that they will not break everything into chaos.
- [- ] I have also tested the proposed changes in combination with various popular addons and can confirm my changes do not break them.

title: Added Unit Tests via MockBukkit
body:
## Description
This PR adds Unit tests to Slimefun and also updates the `pom.xml` with some normalizing changes

## Changes
* Implemented JUnit, MockBukkit, Mockito and JaCoco
* Relocated `LockedCategory ` and `Research` classes
* Added over 60 Unit Tests and a few mock classes
* The `PlayerProfile` class is now completely callback-based and ready for concurrent implementations
* Adjusted some implementations to be more resilient and added more `Validate...` statements to ensure integrity
* Added more documentation
* Relocated `NetworkManager` class
* Deprecated a few things
* Updated GitHubService repository urls
* `PerWorldSettings` now uses `World#getUID()` internally over `World#getName()`
* A bunch of refactoring

## Related Issues
Resolves #1891

## Checklist
<!-- After posting your issue, please check the boxes below if they apply -->
- [x] I have fully tested the proposed changes and promise that they will not break everything into chaos.
- [x] I have also tested the proposed changes in combination with various popular addons and can confirm my changes do not break them.
- [x] I followed the existing code standards and didn't mess up the formatting.
- [x] I did my best to add documentation to any public classes or methods I added.

title: Items stop smelting after a short time in Carbonado Edged Furnace

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: A bug that needs to be fixed.

body:
## Description (Required)
<!-- A clear and detailed description of what exactly the Issue consists of. -->
When smelting items in a Carbonado Edged Furnace after smelting a couple blocks it freezes and discontinues smelting. As per attached screenshot is what occurs

## Steps to reproduce the Issue (Required)
<!-- Youtube Videos and Screenshots are recommended! -->
Smelting in a Carbonado Edged Furnace
![2020-05-10_01 43 17](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/65082068/81478556-a66f0c80-9261-11ea-884d-84d0194533e0.png)

At the time of occurence the furnace had a hopper inputing items and a hopper outputting items from the furnace, I tried breaking and replacing the furnace and also tried placing the furnace on it's own with no surrounding blocks. The same issue occured

## Expected behavior (Required)
<!-- What did you expect to happen? -->
I expected the items to be smelted

## Server Log / Error Report
<!-- Take a look at your Server Log and please provide any error reports you can find via https://pastebin.com/ -->
<!-- We may discard your Issue if you just post it here, as it's unreadable for us. Please use Pastebin! -->

## Environment (Required)
<!-- We may also close your Issue if you are not providing the exact version numbers. -->
<!-- "latest" IS NOT A VERSION NUMBER. -->
<!-- You can also just run "/sf versions" and show us a screenshot of that. -->

 - Minecraft Version: 1.15.2
 - Slimefun Version: DEV - 499 (git c3dbe8f3)
 - CS-CoreLib Version: DEV - 85 (git 4a7fce52)

Mcmmo is installed on the server if this could have anything to do with it conflicting. I have no levels in the 'Smelting' skill on the server so personally don't believe it could affect me if it was a Mcmmo related confliction as it was recently added to the server. I had not made the Carbonado Edged Furnace before Mcmmo was added

title: Buckets Vanishing from Cargo Networks with Fluid Pumps

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: A bug that needs to be fixed.

body:
## Description (Required)
<!-- A clear and detailed description of what exactly the Issue consists of. -->
A simple cargo circuit with two freezers, 4 fluid pumps, and a holding chest for empty buckets and another for water buckets, with round robin enabled on all devices, correctly executed and running perfectly fine on the version 479, results in the deletion of buckets somewhere between the point of the empty bucket leaving the freezer and going to the chest/fluid pump on the version 497. This renders the entire auto-coolant generating circuit un-automated.

## Steps to reproduce the Issue (Required)
<!-- Youtube Videos and Screenshots are recommended! -->
https://lukemango.com/II9oS.png

## Expected behavior (Required)
<!-- What did you expect to happen? -->
The empty buckets should go to the chest and fluid pumps, fill up, and cycle endlessly, and not be deleted from existence.

## Server Log / Error Report
<!-- Take a look at your Server Log and please provide any error reports you can find via https://pastebin.com/ -->
<!-- We may discard your Issue if you just post it here, as it's unreadable for us. Please use Pastebin! -->
No errors

## Environment (Required)
<!-- We may also close your Issue if you are not providing the exact version numbers. -->
<!-- "latest" IS NOT A VERSION NUMBER. -->
<!-- You can also just run "/sf versions" and show us a screenshot of that. -->

 - Minecraft Version: Craftimize (1.15.2)
 - Slimefun Version: vDEV - 497
 - CS-CoreLib Version: vDEV - 85

title: Cargo system voids items transferred at specifc times

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: A bug that needs to be fixed.

body:
## Description
The cargo system can transfer items to blocks which technically do not exist anymore
More specific in the time window between the block being destroyed on the main thread (dropping the current content of the inventory) and the actual removal from the BlockStorage, the cargo system can transfer items to the inventory which will be voided

## Steps to reproduce the Issue
1. Create a simple cargo setup consisting of one cargo manager, one cargo input node and one cargo output node
2. Configure the cargo system in such way that it is transferring items into a slimefun managed inventory container, such as the "Electric Furnace"
3. Destroy the Electric Furnace exactly after the TickerTask has processed Block removals and before it starts processing the tick of the cargo manager
4. Observe how items are transferred into the destroyed Electric Furnace and are destroyed immediately afterwards as the TickerTask processes the removal of the Electric Furnace 

From my testing this is a very rare occasion, and as such a very hard bug to reproduce.
However, with the help of a debugger which is capable of pausing the async TickerTask, it is reproducible every time

## Expected behavior
The item does not transfer, or drops in the world

## Environment
 - Minecraft Version: v1_15_R1
 - Slimefun Version: DEV 489 (git d8964)
 - CS-CoreLib Version: v1.6.3

title: Automated Crafting Chamber ignores crafting-permissions

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: A bug that needs to be fixed.

body:
## Description (Required)
<!-- A clear and detailed description of what exactly the Issue consists of. -->
Individual permissions for sf items only work in the Enchanted Crafting Table. Using the Automated Crafting Chamber bypasses these permissions giving players the ability to craft these items even if they don't have the required permission.
## Steps to reproduce the Issue (Required)
<!-- Youtube Videos and Screenshots are recommended! -->
Set permission for an item in the items.yml, try crafting in enchanted table and get denied, then craft in automated crafting table.
## Expected behavior (Required)
<!-- What did you expect to happen? -->

## Server Log / Error Report
<!-- Take a look at your Server Log and please provide any error reports you can find via https://pastebin.com/ -->
<!-- We may discard your Issue if you just post it here, as it's unreadable for us. Please use Pastebin! -->
No logs required for this.

## Environment (Required)
<!-- We may also close your Issue if you are not providing the exact version numbers. -->
<!-- "latest" IS NOT A VERSION NUMBER. -->
<!-- You can also just run "/sf versions" and show us a screenshot of that. -->

 - Minecraft Version: 1.14.4 Paper #209
 - Slimefun Version: Slimefun4 - DEV 276 (git 74ee0)
 - CS-CoreLib Version: CS-CoreLib - DEV 77 (git 6e171)

title: Talisman of the Whirlwind destroys Trident with Loyalty

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: A bug that needs to be fixed.

body:
## Description (Required)
Only works in PVP player on player situation.  If your target has a wirlwind talisman the trident will be deflected... wherever... but it can't be picked up again.

## Steps to reproduce the Issue (Required)
Have one player have a whirlwind talisman (or both, but the target must have this).  Throw trident at player (regardless of enchant this is the result, but a loyalty enchanted trident should return to you).  Your target will receive the "Your talisman deflected the projectile!" notice... and your trident will be forever stuck in whatever block it got deflected into and unretrievable.
https://imgur.com/a/QaonEBg

## Expected behavior (Required)
Trident should return to the thrower regardless of the talsman the target has. 

## Server Log / Error Report
No errors for this, just observed behavior.

## Environment (Required)
[10:49:14 INFO]: Paper v1_14_R1 (173)
[10:49:14 INFO]:
[10:49:14 INFO]: CS-CoreLib vDEV - 66 (git 9174f09d)
[10:49:14 INFO]: Slimefun vDEV - 142 (git 0d7fc6af)
[10:49:14 INFO]:
[10:49:14 INFO]: Installed Addons (7)
[10:49:14 INFO]:  Barrels vDEV - 2 (git 847bc83b)
[10:49:14 INFO]:  ExtraGear vDEV - 3 (git de222ab7)
[10:49:14 INFO]:  ChestTerminal v1.0
[10:49:14 INFO]:  HotbarPets vDEV - 10 (git 7d790905)

title: Cargo Input Nodes don't transfer whitelisted Items if not-whitelisted items come first

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: A bug that needs to be fixed.

body:
## Description
With an Input Node in Blacklist mode and no items blacklisted, connected to a chest with an Advanced Output Node with an item whitelisted, if any items are blocking the slots before the whitelisted item in the input chest with nowhere to go, the whitelisted item never gets transported.

## Evidence / Proof
GIF: https://i.gyazo.com/7199e6c7f7e7f173fa3c7f1dfa778efc.gif

## Environment
MC version: 1.11.2 (git-Paper-1032)
CS-CoreLib version: 1.5.12
Slimefun version: 4.1.1
